message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to re‐create the tower exactly as shown, without rotating any blocks beyond how they appear in the dictionary.

────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Blocks and Layers
  – The tower uses 9 total blocks, stacked into 6 “layers” from bottom to top.

• Layer‐by‐Layer Breakdown
  1. Bottom Layer (3 blocks side‐by‐side):
     – Left: red arch block  
     – Center: green rectangular block (lying horizontally)  
     – Right: red arch block
  2. Second Layer (1 block):
     – A green rectangular block in the center, on top of the bottom center block
  3. Third Layer (1 block):
     – A red arch block centered above the second‐layer green block
  4. Fourth Layer (2 blocks):
     – Two tall green rectangular blocks, one on the far left and one on the far right, creating two “columns” with a gap in the middle
  5. Fifth Layer (1 block):
     – A yellow rectangular block bridging across the tops of the two green “columns”
  6. Sixth/Top Layer (1 block):
     – A single orange wedge (triangular prism) resting on top as the “roof”

────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────
Below are the exact block‐index matches needed (no rotations allowed):

• Red arch blocks (index 2) …used three times
  – All three red arches in the tower face forward so that the arch is visible from the front.  
• Green rectangular block (index 4) …used twice
  – Both green horizontals are the same short‐rectangular orientation as shown in index 4.  
• Green tall rectangular block (index 5) …used twice
  – The two vertical “pillar” pieces use the tall‐standing green block in index 5.  
• Yellow rectangular block (index 9) …used once
  – A wide yellow piece bridging the tops of the pillars as in index 9.  
• Orange wedge (index 15) …used once
  – The triangular “roof” block matches the orientation of index 15.

Hence the required indices and their counts are:
  → 2 × 3, 4 × 2, 5 × 2, 9 × 1, 15 × 1.

────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────
Use the following moves (in order); each “Move block with index X” refers to placing that exact indexed piece from the dictionary:

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 2    // bottom-left red arch
  Step2:  Move block with index 4    // bottom-center green rectangle
  Step3:  Move block with index 2    // bottom-right red arch
  Step4:  Move block with index 4    // second-layer green rectangle (center)
  Step5:  Move block with index 2    // third-layer red arch (center)
  Step6:  Move block with index 5    // fourth-layer left green pillar
  Step7:  Move block with index 5    // fourth-layer right green pillar
  Step8:  Move block with index 9    // fifth-layer yellow block across pillars
  Step9:  Move block with index 15   // final orange roof wedge on top
}

Following these nine moves (and using each block exactly as depicted in the dictionary images) will reproduce the target tower.
